Posts.Content: May 17, 2012 06:53AM DeterminedFighter wrote: I am scheduled to have a bilateral mastectomy with tissue expanders on May 24th. I am nervous and going through major anxiety issues right now. I have done my research. However, I don't know what to expect from this procedure. Does it hurt badly? If so, for how long? Does radiation make it worse? SMH! This disease has me really feeling like a skitzo at times. One minute I am ok and the next I'm not. I really would like to hear from someone that has been through this procedure before. Help me...nervous and afraid.

Posts.Content: May 20, 2012 12:03PM DeterminedFighter wrote: Vicki...my doctors resqested all scans before starting my herceptin and again before my BMX (5/24). Bone, brain, lung liver, heart, etc. My BS wanted to make sure nothing had spread to my right side or anywherr else. I would discuss it with them. That's puzzling to me. But each dr is different. Hope all goes well for you!!

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2012 12:14PM DeterminedFighter wrote: Hi Ladies... Sorry I haven't been on here in a while but since my surgery on May 24 I have been through major hell. I have been rushed to the emergency roon due to loosing blood, becoming anrmic, cruciating pain, fluid pockets, aspirations, blood transfusion and a second emergency surgery. I had my post op appt yesterday and things are doing much better. I had two drains removed and my pain is much more managable. I am still having some minor spasms but anything is better than what I was dealing with at first. I hope everyone else is doing ok. I feel so out of the loop. I miss you guys...
Posts.Title: May 2012 Mastectomies? Still_Snarky Fearlessfoot

Posts.Content: May 20, 2012 07:01PM DeterminedFighter wrote: Marcia...having my port is the best thing ever. Mine is in my right upper chest. I couldn't imagine being stuck with IV needles every week for treatments/chemo. Not to mention the chemo drugs are so hard on your veins. Your port will make things so much more simple. No more IVs. Hope this helps. Good luck to you.

Posts.Content: May 20, 2012 10:40PM DeterminedFighter wrote: Hi Amy...I too had the numbing sensation with the lumps in my armpit after my axilla dissection. Mine turned out to be adhesions and cording that stemmed from surgery. I was referred to a lymphadema specialist for treatment. I am doing much better. My cords and lumps are breaking up and the numbing has improved some. We do a lot of stretching exercises. But please...do check with your dr. I know its easier said than done but try to relax...it is more than likely scar tissue or the adhesions. Praying everything works out for you.
Posts.Title: Knot in armpit after mastectomy AmyLB DeterminedFighter
